pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:1.1: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:1.2: the monks from the group of six were scaring the monks from the group of seventeen.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:1.7: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:1.8: “How can the monks from the group of six scare other monks?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:1.9: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:1.12: “Foolish men, how can you do this?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:1.14: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:1.15.1: ‘If a monk scares a monk, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.1.4: …The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.1.8: if one who is fully ordained, wishing to scare another who is fully ordained, arranges a sight, a sound, a smell, a taste, or a physical contact, then whether the other monk is scared or not, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.1.9: If he tells him about a wilderness inhabited by criminals, predatory animals, or demons, then whether the other monk is scared or not, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.2.1: If the other person is fully ordained, and he perceives him as such, and he scares him, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.2.2: If the other person is fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, and he scares him, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.2.3: If the other person is fully ordained, but he does not perceive him as such, and he scares him, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.2.4: If, wishing to scare someone who is not fully ordained, he arranges a sight, a sound, a smell, a taste, or a physical contact,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.2.5: then whether the other person is scared or not, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.2.6: If he tells him about a wilderness inhabited by criminals, predatory animals, or demons,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.2.7: then whether the other person is scared or not, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.2.8: If the other person is not fully ordained, but he perceives them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.2.9: If the other person is not fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.2.10: If the other person is not fully ordained, and he does not perceive them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.3.2: if he arranges a sight, a sound, a smell, a taste, or a physical contact, or he tells about a wilderness inhabited by criminals, predatory animals, or demons, but not because he wishes to scare anyone;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.3.4: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.3.5: The training rule on scaring, the fifth, is finished.
